intro: Meliosma confusa, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including India, China, and Southeast Asia. Meliosma confusa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
